title: Résilience des communautés et des écosystèmes

outputs.description: Provide access to solar energy for 3697 households, disaggregated by households led by men and women, in Togo.
Increase the percentage of coal producers in targeted communities using efficient wood carbonization techniques with a yield of over 30% from 0 to 460.

Convert 460 female charcoal producers to alternative income-generating activities in 16 villages as part of a project promoting local development and environmental management practices in rural communities.

title: Accès aux énergies renouvelables en milieu rural au Togo

outputs.description: Provide access to solar energy for households in targeted villages, including households led by women, with a target of 6,525 beneficiaries.
Accelerate access to renewable energy for economic empowerment of rural populations in Togo, benefiting approximately 50,000 people.
Create 1250 new solar energy businesses in targeted villages, benefiting at least 500 people each, as part of a project to accelerate access to renewable energy in rural areas of Togo.

title: Apoyo a la Modernización de La Gestión Ambiental

outputs.description: Increase the number of public environmental policies, plans, and/or programs approved and being implemented from a baseline of 7 to a target of 16.

title: Beyond Recovery COVID19 Energy

outputs.description: Implement a photovoltaic (PV) solar microgrid system for productive use in a community in the Panama Canal Hydrographic Basin, promoting new models of rural electrification in isolated areas.
Implement a microgrid for productive use in a community in the Canal Basin, promoting new models of rural electrification in isolated areas.

title: Africa Mini-grids Program

outputs.description: Beneficiaries benefitting from energy access via minigrids: 4,396 beneficiaries (2,242 women), including 4,190 residential, 80 social services, and 126 people for commercial/productive use.
Mitigate 13.78 ktCO2 of greenhouse gas emissions and achieve an indirect reduction of 643.33 MtCO2 through the Africa Mini-grids Program in Zambia.
Install 450 kW of solar PV capacity and 1.091 MWh of battery storage as part of the Africa Mini-grids Program in Zambia.

title: Solar For health

outputs.description: Provide access to modern electricity service for an estimated 810,000 beneficiaries through the Solar For Health project in Zambia.
Provide uninterrupted power supply to 1002 health facilities and deliver quality health services in Zambia through the Solar For Health project.

title: Greening UNDP Office

outputs.description: Install a 150 kWp solar PV system in the UN Common premises in Zambia, reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 28.12 tCO2 annually and saving USD 4100 in electricity costs.

title: Access to Clean and Renewable Energy

outputs.description: Increase cumulative installed capacity of clean energy mini-grids in project area from 0.385 MW to 2.025 MW through the implementation of 3 minigrids with a total capacity of 385 kW.
Connect 9416 households to mini grids in Malawi, increasing access to clean and renewable energy.

Connect 15 productive users to mini-grids in Malawi, promoting income-generating activities in health care, agriculture, education, and business/industry. The project aims to increase access to clean, affordable, reliable, and modern energy.
Provide access to clean and renewable energy for 10,000 beneficiaries in Malawi through the ACRE Project, aiming to enhance sustainability, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness of energy technologies.
Enhance sustainability, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness of energy technologies to increase access to clean, affordable, reliable, and modern energy for 210,000 direct beneficiaries in Malawi.
Enhance the sustainability, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness of energy technologies to increase access to clean, affordable, reliable, and modern energy.

title: GEF Africa Minigrids Program

outputs.description: Mitigate 1068 metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions (tCO2) through the GEF Africa Minigrids Program in Malawi.
Provide access to 763 direct beneficiaries, disaggregated by gender and customer segment, as a co-benefit of the GEF investment in the solar-powered GEF Africa Minigrids Program in Malawi.
Create 10 direct primary jobs in the minigrid sector, with a focus on gender disaggregation, for minigrid development, operation, and productive use in Malawi.

title: LED and high efficiency transformers in SA

outputs.description: Reduce GHG emissions by 18.5 ktCO2 through the implementation of LED lighting and high efficiency transformers in South Africa, resulting in cumulative savings of tCO2.
Install LED lights and high efficiency transformers in 1,680,000 households in South Africa to improve energy efficiency.

title: South Africa Wind Energy Project (Phase II)

outputs.description: Beneficiaries: 74,230 individuals will benefit annually from project-supported new wind-generated electricity.
Achieve cumulative savings of 70,378 tCO2 through the South Africa Wind Energy Project (Phase II).

Develop and implement a monitoring and verification system at the Department of Energy (IPP Unit) by the end of 2015 to enhance capability in monitoring and verifying the implementation of local content requirements in the South Africa Wind Energy Project (Phase II).
Develop a 1.8 MW small-scale wind farm demonstration project in South Africa as part of the South Africa Wind Energy Project (Phase II).

title: Just Energy Transition Platform

outputs.description: Promote policy-oriented research, stimulate critical debates, and create different narratives on the just energy transition in South Africa. Function as a learning exchange platform for leaders and present policy recommendations for implementation.

title: Just Inclusive Energy Transition

outputs.description: Update and create gender-responsive roadmap documents on skills development and human resource needs for a just inclusive energy transition.
Train 75 youths, with a gender breakdown of 36 females and 39 males, through a vocational training and work placement program on clean energy.
Train 25 trainers (10 female, 15 male) through a pilot ToT program to accelerate a just energy transition in South Africa.
Produce 2 documents on lessons learned and recommendations as part of the Just Inclusive Energy Transition project in South Africa.
Support 10 entrepreneurs, SMMEs, and innovators through an open national innovation challenge on clean energy solutions, with a target of 6 female and 4 male participants.
Provide access to clean energy for 275.52 households through a small-scale solar energy demonstration project, benefiting 82 individuals (45 female / 37 male).
Train 50 community members, including local government officials, on the use and maintenance of solar energy in South Africa.

Train 8 public and private sector and women-led energy civil society organizations (CSOs) on energy transition, with a focus on amplifying the voice of women in the Just Inclusive Energy Transition (JET) discourse.
Organize a learning exchange on energy transition involving 25 stakeholders from the public and private sectors and civil society, with a target of 15 female and 10 male participants.
Finalize one roadmap towards clean energy production, storage, and use.

title: IMPRESS

outputs.description: Increase cumulative electricity generation using renewable energy resources from 82 MW to 132 MW in Samoa.
Beneficiary households benefitting from renewable energy-based electricity generation and energy efficiency technology applications increased to 108,504.
Train 20 local authorities in Samoa to develop, plan, and implement renewable energy, demand-side management/energy efficiency, and power utility reform projects.

title: CAP-IT

outputs.description: Procure 603 electric vehicles for public service delivery, including cars, vans, pick-ups, buses, utility trucks, and outboard motors, in Samoa.
Train and build capacity for 4 government ministries in low-carbon energy activities in Samoa.
Increase the number of articles/communication items per year that specifically refer to low-carbon energy transition to 4.
Develop 4 gender-sensitive planning and policy instruments to support Samoa's transition to low-carbon transport, as part of the CAP-IT project.

Provide access to 200,000 direct project beneficiaries from enhanced policy and regulatory frameworks, awareness and access to information regarding a low-carbon transition in land/maritime transport sectors, improved e-vehicle charging network, inclusive financing mechanisms, etc.

title: AREAN

outputs.description: Increase the percentage of renewable electricity production from 0.018 to 0.73 in Samoa.
Enforce and implement 2 renewable energy and energy efficiency policies, along with associated guidance and regulations, in Samoa.
Incorporate 2 formulated and approved policies and regulations into the country's Energy Act.
Create 8 new jobs in the application of sustainable energy and LE technologies and techniques in the energy supply and energy end-use sectors in Samoa.
Increase the number of energy consumers utilizing energy-efficient appliances and renewable energy-based equipment acquired through AREAN initiatives to 1056.

title: Sustainable Energy Programme

outputs.description: Train 230 professionals and stakeholders in renewable energy and energy efficiency initiatives, supporting entrepreneurship in renewables in Lebanon.

Create 582 person-months of direct additional employment through the implementation of renewable energy and energy efficiency initiatives and the establishment of an enabling environment for entrepreneurship in renewables.

title: Lebanon Sustainable Low-emission Transport Systems

outputs.description: Provide access to 1,417,000 direct project beneficiaries disaggregated by gender in Lebanon through the implementation of sustainable low-emission transport systems.

title: BRA/22/007 Desenvolvimento Sul do Piaui

outputs.description: Construct ecological stoves, cisterns for water storage, and sanitary units for 415 families affected by environmental damage in the southern region of Piaui, Brazil.
Complete execution of the construction of water distribution installations, providing access to water at home for 513 beneficiary families in São Gonçalo do Gurguéia – PI, Brazil.
Train 200 students and teachers from São Gonçalo and surrounding municipalities in environmental protection practices in degraded areas/use of environmental assets and sustainable energy.

title: Electric Mobility Jamaica

outputs.description: Provide access to 20,000 beneficiaries from e-mobility services in Jamaica.
Install 0.01 MW of renewable energy capacity in Jamaica through the Electric Mobility Jamaica project.
Mitigate 76.2 tCO2eq/yr of direct GHG emissions through the Electric Mobility Jamaica project.
Generate $15 million in new low-carbon electric mobility project concepts/proposals with letters of intent from financiers in Jamaica.
Train 40 sector professionals and students in Jamaica in electric mobility, with an equal gender distribution of 20 males and 20 females.
Increase the number of users of eMobility services and vehicles under the pilot from 0 to 5000 in Jamaica.

title: AIM-WELL: Algeria Integrated Management of Waste Energy at the Local Level

outputs.description: Generate 2.0 MWe of electricity through solid waste processing in Algeria as part of the AIM-WELL project, creating value and contributing to the country's energy transition.

title: Support to Algeria energy transition

outputs.description: Define a new sustainable energy mix for Algeria.

title: Italy UNDP Energy Partnership-Algeria

outputs.description: Elaborated funding mobilization plans to support the Italy-Algeria energy partnership through UNDP Rome Centre.

title: Enhanced Rural Resilience in Yemen II

outputs.description: Support introduction of solar energy to 44,825.2 households, including female-headed households, in Yemen through the Enhanced Rural Resilience in Yemen II project.
Increase the number of beneficiaries of enhanced rural resilience in Yemen II from 19 to 363 by 2018 through ERRY I.
Support 111 schools and local offices with solar systems by 2022, benefiting 182,000 people with access to clean energy in Yemen.
Establish 543 solar micro-enterprises, surpassing the baseline of 200 micro businesses in 2018, as part of the Enhanced Rural Resilience in Yemen II project.
Establish 4 solar water irrigation systems supporting 80 households and 124 hectares of farmland by 2022 in Yemen, as part of the Enhanced Rural Resilience in Yemen II project.
Install 4 solar water pumping systems supporting 4 community drinking water projects by 2022, benefiting 805 households and a total of 6,195 individuals in Yemen.
Install 72 solar-powered vaccine refrigerators in health centers, benefiting 60,000 individuals by 2022.
Train and certify 713 women and youth in solar system installation, who will adopt solar innovation in Yemen by 2022.

title: Supporting Resilient Livelihoods, Food Security and Clim

outputs.description: Support 100 facilities with solar systems, benefiting 100,000 individuals by 2024, as part of the Supporting Resilient Livelihoods, Food Security and Climate Adaptations in Yemen (ERRY III) project.

Provide access to renewable energy solutions for public facilities and households, with a target of 3335 beneficiaries, as part of the project "Supporting Resilient Livelihoods, Food Security and Climate Adaptations in Yemen (ERRY III)".
Establish 2 solar and wind energy mini-grids with a total capacity of 0.3 MW in small and medium markets and commercial centers and shops in Yemen by 2024.
Establish 2 waste to energy (WtE) plants with a capacity of 0.2 MW by 2024 in Yemen, supporting resilient livelihoods, food security, and climate adaptations.
Increase the knowledge and skills of 500 people, including women and men of all ages, on decentralized renewable energy innovation and solutions through training and seed grants.

Support waste to energy and water desalination business initiatives with the engagement of women, youths, and the private sector for environmental protection and improvement. Establish 6,000 water desalination plants by 2023.

title: Renewable Energy Improved Access to Health Services

outputs.description: Provide renewable energy access to 79,999 beneficiaries in Yemen, specifically targeting health services and improving livelihood opportunities.
Provide renewable energy access to 11,200 beneficiaries, including improved health services and livelihood opportunities in Yemen through the HEAL project.

Support the establishment of solar microgrid stations to provide clean energy access to households and commercial places, as part of the Renewable Energy for Improved Health Services and Livelihood Opportunities in Yemen (HEAL) project.
Improve access to sustained income for women and men through solar microgrids, targeting an increase from a baseline of 30 to a target of 500 beneficiaries.

title: Piloting e-mobility within Belize’s Public Transport Sys

outputs.description: Implement a national strategy guiding the transformation of Belize's transport sector towards low-carbon electric mobility, including the adoption of e-mobility policies by government ministries and the formal adoption of e-mobility technical standards.
Train 50 national functionaries and operators in fleet operations and management and monitoring, including women, as part of a project piloting e-mobility within Belize's public transport system.
Integrate 5 piloted electric buses into Belize's public transportation sector, increasing the number of users of e-mobility services and vehicles under the pilot to 1500.
Install a minimum of 10 charging stations to pilot e-mobility within Belize's public transport system, resulting in a target of 1300 metric tons of emission avoidance per year.
Implement Belize's raised ambition Nationally Determined Contributions to the UNFCCC and associated Low Emission Development Strategy (LEDS).

title: Engender

outputs.description: Provide access to 200 beneficiaries with a clean reliable source of energy in Belize.

title: Photovoltaics in Punta Negra- Accessing Low Carbon Energy.

outputs.description: Support 281.25 households in Belize with access to clean electricity through the implementation of photovoltaics in Punta Negra, contributing to closing the energy access gap.

title:
Policy
Reforms and Market Transformation of the Energy Efficient Buildings Sector
of the I.R. Iran (EEEB)

outputs.description: Approve draft of energy efficiency certificate framework and enact implementing instruction of EEEM to Market Committee.
Install 0.375 megawatts of renewable or low-emission energy capacity in 8 disaster centers, 1 innovation center, and 11 other buildings in Iran.
Increase solar energy capacity by 1.5 MW in Iran through policy reforms and market transformation of the energy efficient buildings sector.

Hold 164 public awareness events, including courses for women, school students and teachers, general training courses in cultural centers, and training courses for public relation staff, reaching a target of 20,000 people.
